long:
Meaning: to "tend" a flock; i.e. "pasture" it; intransitively, to "graze" (literally or figuratively); generally to "rule"; by extension, to "associate" with (as a friend).
Usage: Ã— break, companion, keep company with, devour, eat up, evil entreat, feed, use as a friend, make friendship with, herdman, keep (sheep) (-er), pastor, shearing house, shepherd, wander, waste.
Source: a primitive root;
